alert.note: Alert for Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 23 at 1:39PM MST until December 24 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 5 PM MST SUNDAY... * WHAT...Snow and low visibility. Total snow accumulations between half an inch and five inches. Winds gusting as high as 50 mph. Visibility between a quarter of a mile and a mile. * WHERE...Yuma, Kit Carson and Cheyenne Counties. * WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 5 PM MST Sunday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Blizzard conditions are possible at times with strong wind gusts and heavy snow. Expect visibility to drop to near a quarter of a mile at times. There is the chance for bands of heavy snow. If these bands form, they could produce an additional three to eight inches of snowfall for small patches of the advisory area. Widespread heavy snow is not expected at this time.
info.instruction: Be sure to check the forecast and road conditions before traveling. Slow down and use caution while traveling. Conditions could change rapidly. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.

area.areaDesc: Cheyenne County; Kit Carson County; Yuma County
